alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, southeastern Caroline, northwestern King William and northwestern Essex Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mangohick to near Beulahville to Aylett. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Aylett around 425 PM EDT. Saint Stephens Church and Beulahville around 435 PM EDT. Newtown around 455 PM EDT. Champlain around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Beazley, Enfield, Hustle, Elevon, Etna Mills, Epworth, Biscoe, Globe, Mount Landing and Duane Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
